EFI Conversions

EFI Done Right

Here’s how we do it right, and how to get the best experience from your EFI install. We’ve been ripping carburetors off and replacing them with throttle body EFI since George W. Bush was in the White House.

After thousands of installs from every brand that makes these “Kits” - we know what works well. We’re picky about the parts choice as well as how these systems are installed as we’ve seen what works best in real world driving on our own cars as well as customers rides.

Ready to go? - Get started >

More Efficient Power Curve

EFI isn’t a magic bullet that solves poor running conditions - but it can make your car easier to start both when cold and hot and increase overall reliability in most driving conditions. It won’t double your fuel mileage but will provide a more efficient burn. It won’t add horsepower - but will make your power curve better.

Make your car run like this >

How Driven Does It Right

Tips from the Pros

After years under cars, we've honed the best installation matched with the right parts to do the job right

Timing Control with EFI

With a few components we can add timing control to most EFI systems. This enables the EFI computer to control the timing curve on your engine as well as the fuel map. This allows us to dial in your advance curve to make your car more responsive and put the fuel and timing map in concert to help make the most power at the right time.

Components Matter

We custom match components to your application based not just on brand name - but your goals for performance and reliability. We don’t cheap out on plumbing and fittings - because who likes to watch their car burn to the ground? We spec in-tank fuel pumps with a return system every time, and have seen the failures not doing this causes. Is it harder or more expensive to do it right? Yes…. But our experience tells us to do it right and pay now, or re-do it later and pay again.

Ready to go - Get started >

Will my car pass smog if I switch to EFI?

In most cases, yes - but with exceptions. We’ve done conversions on smog era vehicles with California legal components in the past - but we need to spec the right components for you. We can’t do this for every vehicle - but kits are available for a surprisingly wide range from various companies.

Ready for a quote for an EFI conversion?

Get started >

What’s the cost?

Each job will be estimated individually, but here are some guidelines to help you budget

For a standard install which includes a Holley Sniper EFI throttle body, AN hose and fittings and an in-tank pump with return and filters.

Each system based on the components that will work best for your application.

You can expect to pay around:

$2,000 - $2,500

for the parts

$1,600 - $1,800

for installation, plumbing, wiring and tuning.

Need some work done on your ride?

Give us a bit to respond with a detailed estimate. We need time to do a through review to research and write your estimate.

1 Give us your info

Describe what work you'd like done. You'll receive a text and email once we've reviewed your request.

2 Get an Estimate

We'll review the work needed, source parts, and write-up a detailed estimate just for you.

3 Approve and Schedule Drop-Off

You'll receive your individualized estimate via text or email. Once you approve the estimate, we'll book your car in the shop and our team will get to work.

4 Time is Money

Only pay for the time our team is working on your car. We use advanced methods for accurate time tracking to ensure you won't pay extra.

5 Hit the Road

Our certified team will repair your car and get you back on the road. We'll do the work and make sure it's done right.

To ensure a prompt response, please enter your valid phone number and email

Please be patient: It can take a day or 2 for smaller jobs and a few days for more complex requests.
